text: Kim Men-sen (Korean: 김민선) is a former North Korean long track speed skater, who was active in the 1950s. Kim Men-sen was, together with Ko Gen-hi, the first North Korean women who represented North Korea at an international speed skating championship. She competed at the World Allround Speed Skating Championships for Women in 1959, finishing 24th overall. She also competed together with Ko Gen-ho at other international competitions, including in a few races in Alma Ata in 1958. == Records== === Personal records === ==References== Category:Place of birth missing (living people) Category:Date of birth missing (living people) Category:North Korean female speed skaters Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
